item.title: Chris add a quote by Elizabeth Cady Stanton
item.description: "The moment we begin to fear the opinions of others and hesitate to tell the truth that is in us, and from motives of policy are silent when we should speak, the divine floods of light and life no longer flow into our souls." -- Elizabeth Cady Stanton

item.title: Chris add a quote by Louisa May Alcott
item.description: "She is too fond of books, and it has turned her brain." -- Louisa May Alcott

item.title: Chris add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "I love deadlines. I love the whooshing noise they make as they go by." -- Douglas Adams

item.title: Chris add a quote by L.M. Montgomery
item.description: "Isn't it nice to think that tomorrow is a new day with no mistakes in it yet?" -- L.M. Montgomery

item.title: Chris add a quote by Michel de Montaigne
item.description: "On the highest throne in the world, we still sit only on our own bottom." -- Michel de Montaigne

item.title: Chris add a quote by Adam Johnson
item.description: "Where we are from... [s]tories are factual. If a farmer is declared a music virtuoso by the state, everyone had better start calling him maestro. And secretly, he'd be wise to start practicing the piano. For us, the story is more important than the person. If a man and his story are in conflict, it is the man who must change." -- Adam Johnson

item.title: Chris add a quote by Nicholson Baker
item.description: "I woke up thinking a very pleasant thought. There is lots left in the world to read." -- Nicholson Baker
